sub_headings: A. Standard Integral Formulae and Their Derivation
B. Reduction to Standard Forms (Completing the Square Method)
C. Integration by Resolving the Numerator (Partial Fractions and Linear Combination)
notes: Focuses on evaluating integrals involving quadratic polynomials using standard forms.
Emphasizes quadratic completion and variable substitution techniques.
Key to mastering JEE Main and Advanced typical integral questions.
tips_to_approach: Always try to complete the square in the denominator to reduce to standard forms.
Memorize the standard integral results given in this subsection for quick application.
For rational integrals where numerator degree is lower than denominator, try expressing numerator in terms of denominator's derivative and constants.
Check for possible substitution (x = a sin θ, x = a tan θ, etc.) whenever quadratic forms match trigonometric identities.
